output_list.reason: The mintToken function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
The setPrices function has a global random variable, which is bad practice and can be a source of unneeded complexity.
The sell function has an integer overflow where the amount of the user's assets are used to buy back his balance.
The buy function has an integer overflow where the user's assets are used to buy his balance.
